text: Washington ( CNN ) Former secretaries of state Hillary Clinton, Colin Powell and Madeleine Albright offered their fictional successor Elizabeth McCord some advice on the rise of white nationalism in America Sunday on CBS's ` ` Madam Secretary.'' The three secretaries of state popped up in the season premiere to counsel McCord, played by Tea Leoni, after a white nationalist group commits a terrorist attack in Washington, DC, and spoke about the importance of cultural diversity in America. ` ` I think what we're all saying is talk about what unites us,'' Clinton says to Leoni's character in the episode. ` ` Even in this moment of peril, remind Americans of our nation's original motto, something that I think about a lot and which seems more important today than ever
